content.html:
Web development

Chen Hui Jing, So your designer wants stuff to overlap

Love that title. Elements in HTML don’t just overlap each other by default. In fact, they intentionally push other elements around so that they don’t. You’ll need CSS to force elements to overlap if you need them to. The traditional ways:

  • negative margins
  • transform translate
  • absolute positioning

But Chen Hui Jing makes sure we don’t forget about grid! It might not come to mind immediately as we mostly think about making a grid and placing individual elements in individual grid cells. But grid cells don’t care! You can put as many elements as you want in a grid cell (or multiple grid cells). They are really just placement coordinates, not slots that only take one element.

Michelle Barker, Quick Tip: Negative Animation Delay

This is one of my favorite classic CSS tricks because it’s so obvious… but only after you’ve learned it. The point is mainly staggered animations. If you want animations to all be at different points along the same animation when they start animating, you can use animation-delay. But if you use a positive time value, the animation won’t start for the first time until that delay (duh). So instead, you use a negative value. The animation starts immediately, but backed up to where it needs to be to have the beginning of the animation hit once the negative delay elapses.

Charlotte Dann, Fancy Frames with CSS

Awesome research from Charlotte, covering lots of ways to make interesting “framed” shapes like these:

So is there one obvious clear best path forward to do this in CSS (and friends)? No — haha. Charlotte explores using 1️⃣ multiple gradient backgrounds (very complicated to construct, limitations with transparency), 2️⃣ border-image (one of the weirder CSS properties, but does help with placing gradients, or SVGs), 3️⃣ mask-border which I’m not sure I’ve ever even looked at in my life (no Firefox support), and finally, 4️⃣ Houdini which has no Firefox or Safari support, but does bring interesting JavaScript-powered opportunities into the mix.

Just to throw another one in the mix here… I happened to be playing with Open Props the other day and it has a “Mask Corner Cuts” section. It just uses mask (or -webkit-mask, as apparently the vendor-prefixed version alone gets the best support).

Scott Vandehey, The Power of CSS Blend Modes

Scott is inspired by other-Scott’s Pen (which happens to be #91 on the Top Pens of 2022 list) and breaks down exactly how it works. It’s a combination of filtering and blending layers. that’s just cool as heck.

You gotta go check out the article to see how Scott was able to stretch the idea to other effects, like a halftone filter.

Kate Rose Morley, Tree views in CSS

This is entirely doable in just semantic HTML and CSS alone:

The trick is putting all the list items that have a sub-list with a <details> element. The text of that <li> becomes whatever the <summary> is. Then you can style the ::marker of the details elements to have the plus-and-minus look rather than the default triangle. I appreciated Kate’s usage of :focus-visible too which keeps the focus styles away from mouse clicks.

The post Chris’ Corner: Relatively Recent Great CSS Writing appeared first on CodePen Blog.

content.html:
Last year, Interop 2022, a collaborative cross-browser initiative, was hugely successful in getting 15 key features implemented interoperably. As developers, we can enjoy the fruits of this collaboration, with features like container queries, cascade layers and dynamic viewport units going from little or no browser support to almost full support in the space of a year.

Interop 2023 has just been announced, expanding to 26 focus areas. Some exciting CSS features include the :has() pseudo-class, which is already supported in some browsers, as well as Level 4 media queries, math functions, and font palette features, which enable custom coloured fonts.

Read the Interop teams’ write-ups here:

  • WebKit
  • Google
  • Igalia
  • Microsoft
  • Mozilla
  • Bocoup

* This article was originally published here
content.text:
Last year, Interop 2022, a collaborative cross-browser initiative, was hugely successful in getting 15 key features implemented interoperably. As developers, we can enjoy the fruits of this collaboration, with features like container queries, cascade layers and dynamic viewport units going from little or no browser support to almost full support in the space of a year.
Interop 2023 has just been announced, expanding to 26 focus areas. Some exciting CSS features include the :has() pseudo-class, which is already supported in some browsers, as well as Level 4 media queries, math functions, and font palette features, which enable custom coloured fonts.
Read the Interop teams’ write-ups here:
WebKit
Google
Igalia
Microsoft
Mozilla
Bocoup
* This article was originally published here

Yes! I do this too. I have one workflow on a 15 minute interval to check and deploy scheduled posts (which means some logic), but my favourite has to be the one which runs at midnight on Jan 1st every year. It's just a curl post like yours to trigger a build so all my copyright year footers get bumped.

I in actuality believe currently been made conscious that the frequency of contemporary voice published on my space has long gone down slightly a small bit.

Good ample swish, I trash-talked Manuel’s internet space on Mastodon and he accurately identified that while I wrote a ambitious two (2) blogposts final 365 days, he wrote around 90 (while additionally doing talks, audits, elevating an small one daughter and doubtlessly coaching for a marathon or some shit fancy that, I imply let’s face it the man is annoyingly productive).

I do know I was slacking off a small bit and those numbers talk for themselves. While I as soon as at the moment desire to write down, solutions continuously salvage it your total approach to a broadcast submit.

Love many others, “write more” is excessive up on my imaginary list of life enhancements and though I don’t as soon as at the moment carry out contemporary 365 days’s resolutions, now feels fancy a gracious time to re-review what’s stopping me there.

I got right here up with seven reasons that I employ to define why I’m no longer writing. In a confusing twist of standpoint, I’m additionally going to clutch a spy at and talk myself out of them by explaining to you, dear Reader, why they are bullshit.

···

# I don’t believe time

This is the massive one, upright? All of us believe assorted things to preserve up out, and writing takes time. In my case, I’ve been in actuality swamped with client initiatives and assorted work final 365 days.

I mediate when you happen to essentially desire to write down though, it’s more a lack of routine than a lack of time itself. Other folks who consistently salvage voice believe discovered to salvage a behavior out of it. I read “Atomic Habits” by James Obvious a couple of months in the past and its message kinda caught with me. It’s about conditioning your self to preserve up out sure things more as soon as at the moment by constructing a routine.

Use 15 minutes each day forward of you take a look at your email and honest write. Or carry out it on your shuttle to work if that you just would possibly presumably perhaps additionally mediate! The trick is to employ amounts of time which shall be so small you would possibly presumably perhaps additionally’t presumably no longer match them on your time desk. It could possibly presumably no longer be ample for a completely-fledged article, but ample to salvage a behavior.

It’s additionally worth noting that your writing doesn’t constantly would possibly presumably perhaps additionally peaceful be wisely-crafted longform blogposts. It must honest be a couple of paragraphs about your solutions, linking out to assorted stuff. Chris does a gargantuan job at this, and others believe currently adopted even shorter formats, mimicking social media posts in dimension.

# I don’t believe anything else interesting to pronounce

The classic impostor syndrome comes out right here. I don’t know anything else particular, so why grief?

The real fact is that each person has something interesting to pronounce attributable to each person faces assorted challenges. You don’t desire to head viral and salvage buzzword-riddled thinkpieces about the original hot topic – There’s ample sites who already carry out that, and AI will at the moment salvage a shitton more of it.

An even bigger opinion is to write down about what you already know and journey on your day-to-day life as a replacement. Authentic posts are constantly precious, and also you are going to solidify your believe files in the technique too.

Right here are a couple of total writing prompts and examples for blogposts I decide to read:

  • “I learnt something” (TIL)
    Michelle Barker: Negative Animation Lengthen
  • “I realized something”
    Dave Rupert: I’m Shadow Banned by DuckDuckGo (and Bing)
  • “I constructed something”
    Lynn Fisher: lynnandtonic.com Refresh
  • 365 days in Review
    Sophie Koonin: 2022: The 365 days in lists
  • Non-public Stuff!
    Cassie Evans: My regular day

# I gotta fix [X] on my space first

This one is particularly standard among developers. “How can I that you just would possibly presumably perhaps additionally mediate write anything else forward of the typography is gracious? How can I ever submit anything else when webmentions are no longer utilized but?” We decide to tinker with our internet sites and that’s cold, but at some level it gets in the form of in actuality the utilization of your blog and rising voice.

Despite what we affirm ourselves, it in actuality doesn’t matter too noteworthy how a blog appears to be like to be or what substances it has. Other folks come for the voice, and as lengthy as they would possibly be able to read it, they’re overjoyed. Throw in an RSS feed so each person can employ their believe reader and also you’re golden. It bother me to pronounce it but Manuel is de facto upright right here.

And if he would possibly presumably perhaps additionally additionally be “redesigning in the originate” for three years while churning out huge amounts of CSS files, your space shall be swish too. 😉

# Others believe already written about this

In most cases I’ve got a gargantuan thought for a submit, but an initial Google search finds that somebody else already beat me to it. The novelty has used off and that assorted submit is a lot better than what I would possibly presumably perhaps additionally believe give you anyway, I affirm myself.

That’s no longer a exact reason pointless to hiss, no one has a monopoly on a topic. Others would possibly presumably perhaps additionally believe already lined the topic – but no longer on your direct, no longer from your standpoint. Probabilities are you’ll presumably perhaps presumably additionally write a submit about the exact similar part and peaceful present precious files the assorted author has missed. Otherwise you would possibly presumably perhaps additionally formula the topic from a assorted angle, for a assorted skill-level or for a assorted viewers.

Any other draw is to read the cloth that is already accessible and clutch notes about your total questions you continue to believe afterwards. Strive to in spite of all the pieces carry out the part (write the code, employ the app, no matter) and seek for what assorted files would believe been precious for you to believe. Write that!

# The second for this has passed

There are writing solutions which shall be impressed by some match or dialog. Perhaps something huge took space on the ranking or I’ve had an extraordinarily interesting discussion on social media. So I sketch out a short outline for a submit and stick it in my drafts folder, thinking I’ll bag help to it later.

Three weeks cross and that lonely draft sits around gathering dust, and by the time I undergo in solutions it, the second has passed. The dialog has moved on, and so the submit is abandoned and at final deleted.

The ranking strikes rather rapidly and there’s constantly a “hot topic of the day”, but that doesn’t imply that no-one is attracted to anything else. A gracious looking out part about blogs is that they’re asynchronous. Probabilities are you’ll presumably perhaps presumably additionally honest write things and keep them accessible, and even supposing they don’t hit a nerve straight, folks can take into legend them of their believe time.

Older posts can additionally bag re-stumbled on years later and bag a second wind, no longer to tag that americans consistently peek for particular things – and your submit shall be honest what they’re attempting to collect then! Some of my veteran posts about webrings and the IndieWeb believe currently stumbled on readers as soon as more since Twitter has started going on the drain. You by no draw know!

# I will’t bag it to sound upright

A couple of the (tech) blogs I read are in English, even supposing its authors are from all the draw thru the arena. For a non-native english speaker fancy myself, it could well as soon as at the moment be ambitious to write down in a international language. It is a ways a barrier in phrases of manufacturing “polished” text – there’s additional brain cycles occupied with getting your solutions to “sound” upright.

This is in a position to presumably additionally very wisely be no longer an infinite deal though. Other folks don’t anticipate to read world-class literature as soon as they come to study out a blogpost about “Lobster Mode”. As lengthy as you would possibly presumably perhaps additionally bag your level all the draw thru, it’s swish when you happen to don’t employ esteem phrases. It must additionally be an benefit: for a world viewers, easy English would possibly presumably perhaps additionally even be more uncomplicated to raise finish.

That being mentioned, that is a usecase the establish AI would possibly presumably perhaps additionally in actuality be precious! While LLMs fancy GPT-3 and co are ineffective at rising exact voice or usual solutions, they’re gargantuan at making sentences sound constructive. Instruments fancy Jasper can rewrite your reproduction and beef up the tone with out changing the contained files. Form of fancy prettier but for English prose.

# Nobody’s going to read it anyway

Let’s be correct: no one likes to yowl into the void. Every person wants their voice to be considered, and social validation is the candy candy dopamine reward we all crave.

There’s nothing unfavorable with sharing your work on social media or standard orange link aggregators either, but as soon as at the moment there honest gained’t be noteworthy of a reaction after you submit. That would possibly presumably feel stressful – but in the extinguish I mediate obesessing over conceitedness metrics is no longer worth it anyway. Just attributable to something doesn’t salvage the frontpage of Reddit does no longer imply it’s no longer precious.

Don’t underestimate how many americans actively read deepest blogs though! The ranking dev community is particularly eager by RSS, and with the Fediverse gaining more and more recognition, usual voice on your believe enviornment has a seriously better attain now than forward of.

Who’s gonna read your deepest blog attributable to it has an RSS feed? I’m gonna read your deepest blog attributable to it has an RSS feed. pic.twitter.com/mtcyKhEVet

— Chris Coyier (@chriscoyier) January 7, 2020

···

Correct, I perceive it’s a small bit uncommon to write down a submit about how I don’t write posts. However I’m hoping to push help on this in 2023 and gather more time for writing. I additionally suspect that assorted folks believe identical reasons and perhaps talking about them helps a small bit.

Despite all the pieces, that’s one more submit in the monetary institution!

children.name: Chris’ Corner: Relatively Recent Great CSS Writing

content.html:
Chen Hui Jing, So your designer wants stuff to overlap

Love that title. Elements in HTML don’t just overlap each other by default. In fact, they intentionally push other elements around so that they don’t. You’ll need CSS to force elements to overlap if you need them to. The traditional ways:

  • negative margins
  • transform translate
  • absolute positioning

But Chen Hui Jing makes sure we don’t forget about grid! It might not come to mind immediately as we mostly think about making a grid and placing individual elements in individual grid cells. But grid cells don’t care! You can put as many elements as you want in a grid cell (or multiple grid cells). They are really just placement coordinates, not slots that only take one element.

Michelle Barker, Quick Tip: Negative Animation Delay

This is one of my favorite classic CSS tricks because it’s so obvious… but only after you’ve learned it. The point is mainly staggered animations. If you want animations to all be at different points along the same animation when they start animating, you can use animation-delay. But if you use a positive time value, the animation won’t start for the first time until that delay (duh). So instead, you use a negative value. The animation starts immediately, but backed up to where it needs to be to have the beginning of the animation hit once the negative delay elapses.

Charlotte Dann, Fancy Frames with CSS

Awesome research from Charlotte, covering lots of ways to make interesting “framed” shapes like these:

So is there one obvious clear best path forward to do this in CSS (and friends)? No — haha. Charlotte explores using 1️⃣ multiple gradient backgrounds (very complicated to construct, limitations with transparency), 2️⃣ border-image (one of the weirder CSS properties, but does help with placing gradients, or SVGs), 3️⃣ mask-border which I’m not sure I’ve ever even looked at in my life (no Firefox support), and finally, 4️⃣ Houdini which has no Firefox or Safari support, but does bring interesting JavaScript-powered opportunities into the mix.

Just to throw another one in the mix here… I happened to be playing with Open Props the other day and it has a “Mask Corner Cuts” section. It just uses mask (or -webkit-mask, as apparently the vendor-prefixed version alone gets the best support).

Scott Vandehey, The Power of CSS Blend Modes

Scott is inspired by other-Scott’s Pen (which happens to be #91 on the Top Pens of 2022 list) and breaks down exactly how it works. It’s a combination of filtering and blending layers. that’s just cool as heck.

You gotta go check out the article to see how Scott was able to stretch the idea to other effects, like a halftone filter.

Kate Rose Morley, Tree views in CSS

This is entirely doable in just semantic HTML and CSS alone:

The trick is putting all the list items that have a sub-list with a <details> element. The text of that <li> becomes whatever the <summary> is. Then you can style the ::marker of the details elements to have the plus-and-minus look rather than the default triangle. I appreciated Kate’s usage of :focus-visible too which keeps the focus styles away from mouse clicks.

The post Chris’ Corner: Relatively Recent Great CSS Writing appeared first on CodePen Blog.

How do you underline an animated text?

Hover underline animation
  1. Use display: inline-block to make the underline span just the width of the text content.
  2. Use the :after pseudo-element with width: 100% and position: absolute to place it below the content.
  3. Use transform: scaleX(0) to initially hide the pseudo-element.

How do you hover underline in HTML?

“underline on hover html” Code Answer’s
  1. a:hover {
  2. text-decoration: underline;
  3. }

Draw Underline Link Hover Effect | CSS Menu Hover Effect

Watch The Video Below

Draw Underline Link Hover Effect | CSS Menu Hover Effect Draw Underline Link Hover Effect | CSS Menu Hover Effect

Images related to the topicDraw Underline Link Hover Effect | CSS Menu Hover Effect

Draw Underline Link Hover Effect | Css Menu Hover Effect

Can you animate text-decoration?

As it turns out, text-decoration is not one of the properties that can be animated at all, including transitions. So, I went another route. By applying a bottom border instead, I can simulate an underline, and I can animate it.

See also Android Studio Attributes Missing? All Answers

How do you create an underline in CSS?

The property text-decoration-line is used to underline the text. This property has three values that are overline, underline, or line-through. So, the value underline is used to underline the text in CSS. This value draws the underline beneath the inline text.

How do you underline text in after effects?

The After Effects text engine does not have an underline feature. But, as with most things in After Effects, there are a million ways to do things. You can simply add a solid layer, draw a path under the text, and apply the stroke effect. You can draw a shape layer as a line under your text.

How do you make text not underlined in a link?

Here’s where you will need to add a bit of HTML code to force the link to not underline.
  1. First, you’ll add a style attribute inside the a tag, like this <a style=. …
  2. Next, you’ll add “text-decoration:none;” after the style tag which tells the link we don’t want it to be underlined.

How do I remove the underline from a hyperlink in CSS?

How to Remove the Underline from Links in CSS
  1. Add your HTML to the section of your webpage.
  2. Define the four pseudo-classes of links with the text-decoration property in the section.
  3. Make sure that a:link and a:visited come before a:hover, and a:active comes last. …
  4. Set each property value to “none.”

How do you animate lines in CSS?

In CSS, it is not possible to animate text-decoration: line-through width. However, you can use a pseudo-element instead (such as ::before or ::after ) to create a strikethrough line that grows in width, for example, from 0 to 100% on hover.

How do you animate a strikethrough in Powerpoint?

To apply strikethrough:
  1. Select the text you want to strikethrough.
  2. Click the Home tab in the Ribbon.
  3. Click the dialog box launcher on the bottom right of the Font group (corner button). A dialog box appears.
  4. Select or check Strikethrough. You can also select Double Strikethrough.
  5. Click OK or press Enter.

How do you create an underline in HTML?

To underline a text in HTML, use the <u> tag. The <u> tag deprecated in HTML, but then re-introduced in HTML5. Now it represents a text different from another text stylistically, such as a misspelled word.

How do I make a small underline in HTML?

CSS
  1. .underline-small{
  2. color:green;
  3. display:inline-block;
  4. }
  5. .underline-small::after{

How do you underline an image in HTML?

You’ll first need to ID your image in your HTML file, then go to your CSS file, call your ID, and in the brackets, say ‘text-decoration: underline;’ .

How do you add an underline in Adobe?

Highlight, strikethrough, or underline text
  1. Choose Tools > Comment, and select the Highlight Text tool , the Strikethrough Text tool , or the Underline Text tool . Note: …
  2. Drag from the beginning of the text you want to mark up. …
  3. (Optional) To add a note, double-click the markup and add text in a pop-up note.

How do you underline in Illustrator?

Use the keyboard shortcut “T” to equip the Type tool. Click & drag on the artboard to draw a text box. Click & drag over the text you want to underline. Finally, open the Character menu at the top of your screen and click the Underline button.

See also Powershell Goto Command? Top 6 Best Answers

Do hyperlinks not show underlined?

Remove the underline from hyperlink text
  1. Right-click the hyperlink text, and then click Remove Hyperlink.
  2. On the Insert tab, in the Illustrations group, click Shapes, and then under Rectangles, click Rectangle.
  3. Drag to draw the rectangle so that it covers the hyperlink text that you want to hide.

How do I make a link not blue or underlined?

Remove Blue Underline From Link in CSS
  1. Set the text-decoration Property to none to Remove Blue Underline From a Link in CSS.
  2. Use Pseudo-Classes for Selection to Remove Blue Underline From a Link in CSS.
  3. Remove the box-shadow Property to Remove the Underline and Color From a Link in CSS.

How do you not underline a link in PowerPoint?

While PowerPoint doesn’t have a specific option for removing the underline from hyperlink text, there’s a very simple workaround. What we’re going to do is remove the link from the text, place an invisible shape over that text, and then add the link to that shape.

To apply strikethrough:

Select the text you want to strikethrough.
Click the Home tab in the Ribbon.
Click the dialog box launcher on the bottom right of the Font group (corner button). A dialog box appears.
Select or check Strikethrough. You can also select Double Strikethrough.
Click OK or press Enter.
How do you create an underline in HTML?
To underline a text in HTML, use the <u> tag. The <u> tag deprecated in HTML, but then re-introduced in HTML5. Now it represents a text different from another text stylistically, such as a misspelled word.

display:inline-block;

How do you underline an image in HTML?
You’ll first need to ID your image in your HTML file, then go to your CSS file, call your ID, and in the brackets, say ‘text-decoration: underline;’ .
How do you add an underline in Adobe?


Highlight, strikethrough, or underline text

Choose Tools > Comment, and select the Highlight Text tool , the Strikethrough Text tool , or the Underline Text tool . Note: … 
Drag from the beginning of the text you want to mark up. … 
(Optional) To add a note, double-click the markup and add text in a pop-up note.
How do you underline in Illustrator?
Use the keyboard shortcut “T” to equip the Type tool. Click & drag on the artboard to draw a text box. Click & drag over the text you want to underline. Finally, open the Character menu at the top of your screen and click the Underline button.
See also  Powershell Goto Command? Top 6 Best AnswersDo hyperlinks not show underlined?


Remove the underline from hyperlink text

Right-click the hyperlink text, and then click Remove Hyperlink.
On the Insert tab, in the Illustrations group, click Shapes, and then under Rectangles, click Rectangle.
Drag to draw the rectangle so that it covers the hyperlink text that you want to hide.

How do you not underline a link in PowerPoint?
While PowerPoint doesn’t have a specific option for removing the underline from hyperlink text, there’s a very simple workaround. What we’re going to do is remove the link from the text, place an invisible shape over that text, and then add the link to that shape.
